meanings.definition: To shout loudly or aggressively at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He beshouts his frustration at the noisy construction outside.
meanings.sent2: The coach beshouts instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The toddler beshouts 'No!' when asked to eat vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm beshouts its fury across the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The angry customer beshouts complaints at the manager.

meanings.definition: To fill with loud or aggressive shouting.
meanings.sent1: The stadium beshouts with cheers as the team scores a goal.
meanings.sent2: The protest beshouts the streets with demands for change.
meanings.sent3: The party beshouts with laughter and music late into the night.
meanings.sent4: The courtroom beshouts with arguments from both sides.
meanings.sent5: The classroom beshouts with excitement during the science experiment.

meanings.definition: To overwhelm with loud or aggressive shouting.
meanings.sent1: The speaker beshouts the audience with his powerful speech.
meanings.sent2: The sirens beshout the neighborhood, warning of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The siblings beshout each other over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The music festival beshouts the city with live performances.
meanings.sent5: The fans beshout their support for the team at the championship game.
